bibl.note: This is a brief letter dated November 30, 1845 from William Shapard to Tennessee Governor Aaron Venable Brown in Nashville. In the letter he informs Governor Brown of the detention of John Smith in the county jail at Brownsville, Tennessee.

opener.salute: To his excellency the Governor of TennesseeDear Sir,

div.p: I have this day delivered John Smith in the county jail at Brownsville__ I am informed that a reward of $250 was offered for him by the governor__
Owing to the coldness of the weather, and the bad road, and distance I have taken no further steps than to confine him in jail safely__
At a suitable time I will apply for the reward__
